title: Sandra_hakeem
author: Sandra_hakeem
content: Yeah , I have been very active in the forum for about 3 months now and I have known every other thing I discuss about except one: "Epochtalk" .¬† I'm just tired of pretending to know this one thing when I don't.I understand that it's a discussion site just like bitcointalk but my Point of confusion is; ¬†Is the site gonna replace bitcointalk or is that gonna be a new name? ¬†If it's another platform entirely, are we all still gonna register there?¬†What is this platform gonna be about? Bitcoin?Please, I need answers cus honestly, it's something I dunno. No insults, please.RSVP ‚ò∫Ô∏èSandra üë©‚Äçü¶±

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: September 20, 2022, 11:09:36 PMLast edit: September 20, 2022, 11:20:56 PM by PX-Z
comments.body: Its only the name of the new under development forum software, you can call it a substitute to SMF/simple machine. Once migrated, all data here will be transfered there, host, domain name, etc. so there's no need to register again. So the platform is still bitcointalk, its members, staff/mods, and admins. Although we are waiting for ages now before we can migrate there.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: What PX-Z said. Upgrades like this(assuming it actually happens at some point lmao) should only work in the back-end, without you needing to do anything. It would be totally incompetent(and really bad business-wise) of Theymos if we'd have to start everything from scratch.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra_hakeem on September 20, 2022, 11:00:55 PM<...>There are quite a few theads about it here, and I‚Äôd also look through the recent posts (2022) made on this thread . You can take a look at what the software looks like here, although bear in mind that it is not a ported environment (i.e. DB content, profiles, boards, not even complete functionality such as Merits and so forth).One thing to consider is that what is being created by intent is a software on which to run forums of all sorts (a kind of SMF if you will, from an abstract point of view), not just a custom implementation for a one-off forum called Bitcointalk. This means that software development is much more complex, as it has to work with open customizable concepts to support different forum configurations and functionality, and not just something 100% tailored only to Bitcointalk. This approach certainly is behind the massive overhead of time and resources being invested in the project, although on its own likely does not justify the delay.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on September 21, 2022, 08:18:11 AMQuote from: Don Pedro Dinero on September 21, 2022, 03:35:01 AMI believe that in 2017, when I registered, the project was already underway.In 2015 too By now, I'm totally okay with sticking to this old SMF forum forever.Yeah, that's what I remember as well.I mean, come on....the forum has had the same basic layout and only tweaks to its functionality since its inception (from what I gather, anyway; I was not here in 2009).¬† Why change it now?¬† The late 2000s look it has sort of represents the staying power that bitcoin itself has, and if bitcointalk suddenly had a totally different appearance, it would be jarring to say the least.Not to mention that I don't actually believe there's ever going to be that new forum software we've all heard so much about for so many years.¬† I think that's Theymos's idea of an extremely prolonged April Fool's joke.
